page.title: 13Stagsden Bird Gardens
page.content: The garden opened in 1965 and was one of the first Bird Zoos.It started from a small collection of pheasants but today over 150 species of bird can be seen including Cranes, Owls, Parrots, Birds of Prey, and old breeds of poultry.Pheasants still figure prominently and large numbers are still bred here each year as many species are very rare in the wild and it is therefore important to build up reserves of stock in captivity. In May 1985 the garden received an award from the National Federation of Zoo Gardens of Great Britain and Ireland for the first captive breeding in the U.K. of 3 Common Cranes (Grus Grus). The garden is often visited by schools.
